Disease.content:

Paragraph: There has been no previous finding of a glycine substitution that is not associated with any obvious phenotype in homozygous individuals .

| No finding of a glycine substitution associated with an obvious phenotype in homozygous individuals |

This paragraph does not mention any specific disease entities, but rather describes a finding related to a "glycine substitution" in "homozygous individuals" without any apparent associated phenotype. Therefore, the entire phrase is presented as the disease entity in this instance.

| No finding of a glycine substitution associated with an obvious phenotype in homozygous individuals |

This paragraph describes a specific genetic finding, "a glycine substitution," and its association with "an obvious phenotype" in "homozygous individuals." Since a phenotype refers to the observable characteristics or traits of an organism, and a disease is a specific type of phenotype, this finding can be considered a disease entity. Therefore, the entire phrase is presented as the disease entity in this instance.
